SENT.plain: Muckle-Wells syndrome is a rare autosomal dominant disease that belongs to a group of hereditary febrile syndromes
It is characterized by recurrent and self-limited episodes of fever, urticaria, arthralgia, myalgia and conjunctivitis since childhood, which are related to exposure to cold temperatures
Lately, progressive sensorineural hearing loss occurs
Amyloidosis is the main complication and can be found in about 25% of the cases

It has been demonstrated that there is an association with mutations in the NLRP3 gene, which codifies cryopyrin, a protein responsible for regulating the production of proinflammatory cytokines, such as interleukin-1Beta
The authors report four cases of the disease within a family
